lifeEvents.description: Worked at Young England kindergarten in Pimlico, London

lifeEvents.title: First met Prince Charles
lifeEvents.description: Met Prince Charles while he was dating her sister Sarah Spencer

lifeEvents.title: Began dating Prince Charles
lifeEvents.description: Romance began when Diana was 19 and Charles was 32

lifeEvents.title: Engagement announced
lifeEvents.description: Engagement to Prince Charles announced, became instant global celebrity

lifeEvents.title: Married Prince Charles
lifeEvents.description: Married in St. Paul's Cathedral, watched by 750 million people worldwide, called 'wedding of the century'

lifeEvents.title: Became Princess of Wales
lifeEvents.description: Received title Princess of Wales, became most photographed woman in world

lifeEvents.title: Son William born
lifeEvents.description: First child Prince William born, second in line to throne

lifeEvents.title: First official overseas tour
lifeEvents.description: Toured Australia and New Zealand with Charles, massive public success

lifeEvents.title: Son Harry born
lifeEvents.description: Second son Prince Harry born, completed royal family

lifeEvents.title: Began charity work
lifeEvents.description: Became patron of numerous charities, focused on AIDS, homelessness, and landmines

lifeEvents.title: AIDS activism
lifeEvents.description: Opened first AIDS ward at Middlesex Hospital, shook hands with AIDS patient without gloves

lifeEvents.title: Marriage problems emerged
lifeEvents.description: Relationship with Charles deteriorated, both had extramarital affairs

lifeEvents.title: Morton book published
lifeEvents.description: 'Diana: Her True Story' by Andrew Morton revealed marriage problems

lifeEvents.title: Separation announced
lifeEvents.description: Prime Minister John Major announced formal separation from Prince Charles

lifeEvents.title: Panorama interview
lifeEvents.description: BBC interview watched by 23 million, discussed adultery and bulimia

lifeEvents.title: Stripped of HRH title
lifeEvents.description: Lost 'Her Royal Highness' title in divorce settlement

lifeEvents.title: Divorced Prince Charles
lifeEvents.description: Divorce finalized, received £17 million settlement

lifeEvents.title: Landmines campaign
lifeEvents.description: Campaigned against landmines, walked through minefield in Angola

lifeEvents.title: Relationship with Dodi Fayed
lifeEvents.description: Began romance with Dodi Fayed, son of Harrods owner Mohamed Al-Fayed

lifeEvents.title: Last public appearance
lifeEvents.description: Visited landmine victims in Bosnia Herzegovina

lifeEvents.title: Died in car accident
lifeEvents.description: Killed in car crash in Pont de l'Alma tunnel in Paris with Dodi Fayed

lifeEvents.title: Global mourning
lifeEvents.description: Unprecedented global outpouring of grief, flowers left outside palaces

lifeEvents.title: Funeral
lifeEvents.description: Funeral at Westminster Abbey watched by 2.5 billion people worldwide

lifeEvents.title: Diana Memorial Fund established
lifeEvents.description: Charitable fund established to continue her humanitarian work

lifeEvents.title: Born in Gary, Indiana
lifeEvents.description: Born to Katherine and Joseph Jackson in working-class Gary, Indiana, seventh of nine children

lifeEvents.title: First public performance
lifeEvents.description: At age 5, performed with brothers at school talent show, noticed for exceptional talent

lifeEvents.title: Joined Jackson 5
lifeEvents.description: Joined family group The Jackson 5 as lead singer, managed by strict father Joe Jackson

lifeEvents.title: Rose to Fame with The Jackson 5
lifeEvents.description: Signed with Motown Records, became child sensation with brothers

lifeEvents.title: First hit 'I Want You Back'
lifeEvents.description: Jackson 5's first single reached #1, launched Michael's career at age 11

lifeEvents.title: Solo career began
lifeEvents.description: Released first solo album 'Got to Be There' while still with Jackson 5

lifeEvents.title: Hit song 'Ben'
lifeEvents.description: Solo single 'Ben' reached #1, showed his potential as solo artist

lifeEvents.title: Left Motown for Epic Records
lifeEvents.description: Jackson family signed with Epic Records, became The Jacksons

lifeEvents.title: Film debut in 'The Wiz'
lifeEvents.description: Starred as Scarecrow in musical film adaptation, met producer Quincy Jones

lifeEvents.title: Released 'Off the Wall'
lifeEvents.description: First adult solo album produced by Quincy Jones, established him as solo star

lifeEvents.title: First moonwalk on TV
lifeEvents.description: Performed moonwalk dance move on Motown 25 TV special, became signature move

lifeEvents.title: Released 'Thriller'
lifeEvents.description: Released album that became best-selling album of all time with over 66 million copies

lifeEvents.title: 'Thriller' music video premiered
lifeEvents.description: 14-minute 'Thriller' video revolutionized music videos, became cultural phenomenon

lifeEvents.title: Hair caught fire during Pepsi commercial
lifeEvents.description: Suffered second-degree burns to scalp during commercial filming, began using painkillers

lifeEvents.title: Won record 8 Grammy Awards
lifeEvents.description: Set record for most Grammy wins in single night for 'Thriller'

lifeEvents.title: Purchased ATV Music Publishing
lifeEvents.description: Bought catalog including Beatles songs for $47.5 million, strained friendship with Paul McCartney

lifeEvents.title: Released 'Bad'
lifeEvents.description: Third solo album produced 5 #1 singles, first album to achieve this feat

lifeEvents.title: Bad World Tour
lifeEvents.description: First solo world tour, attended by 4.4 million fans across 15 countries

lifeEvents.title: Autobiography 'Moonwalk' published
lifeEvents.description: Bestselling autobiography ghostwritten by Jackie Kennedy's editor

lifeEvents.title: Purchased Neverland Ranch
lifeEvents.description: Bought 2,700-acre ranch in California for $19.5 million, created private amusement park

lifeEvents.title: Released 'Dangerous'
lifeEvents.description: Fourth solo album, first produced without Quincy Jones

lifeEvents.title: Super Bowl XXVII halftime show
lifeEvents.description: Legendary halftime performance, revolutionized Super Bowl entertainment

lifeEvents.title: First child abuse allegations
lifeEvents.description: Accused of child sexual abuse by 13-year-old Jordy Chandler, settled out of court

lifeEvents.title: Married Lisa Marie Presley
lifeEvents.description: Surprise marriage to Elvis Presley's daughter, ended in divorce 20 months later

lifeEvents.title: Released 'HIStory'
lifeEvents.description: Double album with greatest hits and new material, addressed controversies

lifeEvents.title: Married Debbie Rowe
lifeEvents.description: Married nurse Debbie Rowe, had two children: Michael Jr. and Paris

lifeEvents.title: Son Prince Michael born
lifeEvents.description: First child Michael Joseph Jackson Jr. (Prince) born

lifeEvents.title: Daughter Paris born
lifeEvents.description: Daughter Paris-Michael Katherine Jackson born

lifeEvents.title: Released 'Invincible'
lifeEvents.description: Final studio album, most expensive album ever produced at $30 million

lifeEvents.title: Son Blanket born
lifeEvents.description: Third child Prince Michael Jackson II (Blanket) born via surrogate

lifeEvents.title: Dangled baby from balcony incident
lifeEvents.description: Caused controversy by briefly dangling baby son from hotel balcony in Berlin

lifeEvents.title: Second child abuse trial
lifeEvents.description: Tried on child molestation charges, acquitted on all counts

lifeEvents.title: Financial troubles and exile
lifeEvents.description: Faced bankruptcy, lived in exile in Bahrain and Ireland

lifeEvents.title: Announced 'This Is It' concerts
lifeEvents.description: Announced comeback tour of 50 concerts at London's O2 Arena

lifeEvents.title: Final rehearsal
lifeEvents.description: Last rehearsal at Staples Center in Los Angeles

lifeEvents.title: Death
lifeEvents.description: Died of cardiac arrest at age 50 from propofol overdose, doctor Conrad Murray convicted

lifeEvents.title: Memorial service
lifeEvents.description: Memorial at Staples Center watched by over 1 billion people worldwide

lifeEvents.title: 'This Is It' documentary released
lifeEvents.description: Documentary using rehearsal footage became highest-grossing concert film

lifeEvents.title: Born in Atchison, Kansas
lifeEvents.description: Born to Samuel and Amy Earhart, spent childhood with maternal grandparents

lifeEvents.title: Saw first airplane
lifeEvents.description: Saw airplane at Iowa State Fair, was not impressed initially

lifeEvents.title: Graduated high school
lifeEvents.description: Graduated from Hyde Park High School in Chicago

lifeEvents.title: Worked as nurse's aide in WWI
lifeEvents.description: Worked with wounded soldiers in Toronto, contracted pneumonia

lifeEvents.title: Attended Columbia University
lifeEvents.description: Studied pre-med but left after one year due to family financial problems

lifeEvents.title: First airplane ride
lifeEvents.description: 10-minute flight with pilot Frank Hawks at Daugherty Field, Los Angeles

lifeEvents.title: First flying lesson
lifeEvents.description: Began lessons with female instructor Neta Snook, saved money for lessons

lifeEvents.title: Bought first airplane
lifeEvents.description: Purchased bright yellow Kinner Airster biplane, named it 'The Canary'

lifeEvents.title: Set first aviation record
lifeEvents.description: Set women's altitude record at 14,000 feet

lifeEvents.title: Received pilot's license
lifeEvents.description: 16th woman to receive pilot's license from Federation Aeronautique Internationale

lifeEvents.title: Moved to Boston
lifeEvents.description: Worked as social worker and teacher while staying involved in aviation

lifeEvents.title: Became first woman to fly across Atlantic
lifeEvents.description: Flew as passenger with pilots Wilmer Stultz and Louis Gordon from Newfoundland to Wales

lifeEvents.title: Atlantic crossing brought fame
lifeEvents.description: Became instant celebrity, called 'Lady Lindy' for resemblance to Charles Lindbergh

lifeEvents.title: Became aviation editor
lifeEvents.description: Became aviation editor of Cosmopolitan magazine

lifeEvents.title: Founded Ninety-Nines
lifeEvents.description: Co-founded organization for female pilots, served as first president

lifeEvents.title: Set transcontinental speed record
lifeEvents.description: Set women's speed record flying coast to coast in 19 hours, 16 minutes

lifeEvents.title: Married George Putnam
lifeEvents.description: Married publisher George Putnam, kept maiden name and continued career

lifeEvents.title: First Woman to Fly Solo Across the Atlantic
lifeEvents.description: Flew alone from Newfoundland to Ireland in 14 hours 56 minutes, landed in pasture due to mechanical problems

lifeEvents.title: Received Distinguished Flying Cross
lifeEvents.description: First woman to receive DFC from Congress for transatlantic solo flight

lifeEvents.title: First person to fly solo across Pacific
lifeEvents.description: Flew solo from Honolulu to Oakland, California in 18 hours

lifeEvents.title: Faculty position at Purdue University
lifeEvents.description: Counseled women students on careers and served as technical advisor

lifeEvents.title: Purdue funded new aircraft
lifeEvents.description: University purchased Lockheed Electra 10E for her research, called it 'flying laboratory'

lifeEvents.title: Announced round-the-world flight
lifeEvents.description: Announced plan to circumnavigate globe at equator, longest route possible

lifeEvents.title: First attempt failed
lifeEvents.description: Crashed during takeoff in Hawaii, damaged aircraft, postponed flight

lifeEvents.title: Began second attempt
lifeEvents.description: Started world flight from Miami, flew east with navigator Fred Noonan

lifeEvents.title: Reached New Guinea
lifeEvents.description: Completed 22,000 miles of flight, 7,000 miles remaining

lifeEvents.title: Final takeoff
lifeEvents.description: Departed Lae, New Guinea for Howland Island, last confirmed radio contact

lifeEvents.title: Disappeared During a Flight
lifeEvents.description: Lost radio contact near Howland Island in Pacific, never found despite massive search

lifeEvents.title: Search efforts continued
lifeEvents.description: U.S. Navy and Coast Guard conducted most extensive search in Pacific history

lifeEvents.title: Declared legally dead
lifeEvents.description: Court declared Earhart dead in absentia, search officially ended

lifeEvents.title: Born in log cabin in Kentucky
lifeEvents.description: Born to Thomas Lincoln and Nancy Hanks in a one-room log cabin in Hodgenville, Kentucky

lifeEvents.title: Mother died
lifeEvents.description: Mother Nancy died of milk sickness when Abraham was 9 years old

lifeEvents.title: Family moved to Illinois
lifeEvents.description: Moved with family to Illinois, began life on his own

lifeEvents.title: Served in Black Hawk War
lifeEvents.description: Enlisted as volunteer in Illinois militia, elected captain by his unit

lifeEvents.title: Began political career
lifeEvents.description: Elected to Illinois State Legislature as Whig Party member at age 25

lifeEvents.title: Became lawyer
lifeEvents.description: Received law license after self-education, began practice in Springfield

lifeEvents.title: Married Mary Todd
lifeEvents.description: Married Mary Todd after troubled courtship, had four sons together

lifeEvents.title: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives
lifeEvents.description: Served single term in Congress, opposed Mexican-American War

lifeEvents.title: Son Eddie died
lifeEvents.description: Second son Edward died at age 3, likely from tuberculosis

lifeEvents.title: Returned to law practice
lifeEvents.description: Left politics temporarily, became successful railroad attorney

lifeEvents.title: Re-entered politics over slavery
lifeEvents.description: Kansas-Nebraska Act sparked return to politics, opposed slavery expansion

lifeEvents.title: Joined Republican Party
lifeEvents.description: Helped found Illinois Republican Party, became prominent anti-slavery voice

lifeEvents.title: Lincoln-Douglas debates
lifeEvents.description: Seven debates with Stephen Douglas for Senate, lost election but gained national fame

lifeEvents.title: Cooper Union speech
lifeEvents.description: Delivered pivotal speech in New York, established credentials for presidency

lifeEvents.title: Elected President
lifeEvents.description: Won presidency with only 40% of popular vote, no Southern states

lifeEvents.title: Southern states began seceding
lifeEvents.description: Seven Southern states seceded before inauguration, formed Confederacy

lifeEvents.title: Inaugurated as 16th President
lifeEvents.description: Delivered First Inaugural Address appealing for unity

lifeEvents.title: Civil War began
lifeEvents.description: Confederate attack on Fort Sumter started Civil War

lifeEvents.title: Son Willie died
lifeEvents.description: 11-year-old son William died of typhoid fever in White House

lifeEvents.title: Issued Emancipation Proclamation
lifeEvents.description: Freed slaves in Confederate states, transformed war into moral crusade

lifeEvents.title: Delivered Gettysburg Address
lifeEvents.description: Gave 272-word speech at cemetery dedication, redefined war's purpose

lifeEvents.title: Re-elected President
lifeEvents.description: Won second term with 55% of vote on National Union ticket

lifeEvents.title: Second Inaugural Address
lifeEvents.description: Delivered conciliatory speech: 'With malice toward none, with charity for all'

lifeEvents.title: Civil War ended
lifeEvents.description: General Lee surrendered at Appomattox Court House

lifeEvents.title: Assassinated at Ford's Theatre
lifeEvents.description: Shot by John Wilkes Booth while watching play, died next morning at age 56

lifeEvents.title: Born in Alexandria
lifeEvents.description: Born into Ptolemaic dynasty, descendant of Alexander the Great's general Ptolemy

lifeEvents.title: Father Ptolemy XII died
lifeEvents.description: Father died, became co-ruler with 10-year-old brother Ptolemy XIII at age 18

lifeEvents.title: Civil war with brother
lifeEvents.description: Forced into exile by brother's advisors, fled to Syria to raise army

lifeEvents.title: Met Julius Caesar
lifeEvents.description: Smuggled herself to Caesar in carpet/bed linens, formed alliance and romance

lifeEvents.title: Caesar defeated Ptolemy XIII
lifeEvents.description: Brother drowned in Nile after defeat, Cleopatra became sole ruler

lifeEvents.title: Son Caesarion born
lifeEvents.description: Gave birth to son allegedly fathered by Julius Caesar

lifeEvents.title: Visited Rome with Caesar
lifeEvents.description: Lived in Rome as Caesar's guest, fled after his assassination

lifeEvents.title: Met Mark Antony
lifeEvents.description: Summoned to Tarsus by Mark Antony, arrived in golden barge dressed as Aphrodite

lifeEvents.title: Twins born with Antony
lifeEvents.description: Gave birth to twins Alexander Helios and Cleopatra Selene

lifeEvents.title: Married Mark Antony
lifeEvents.description: Married Antony despite his existing marriage to Octavia

lifeEvents.title: Son Ptolemy Philadelphus born
lifeEvents.description: Third child with Mark Antony born

lifeEvents.title: Donations of Alexandria
lifeEvents.description: Antony distributed Roman territories to Cleopatra's children, angered Rome

lifeEvents.title: War declared by Octavian
lifeEvents.description: Octavian declared war on Cleopatra (not Antony) to avoid civil war appearance

lifeEvents.title: Battle of Actium
lifeEvents.description: Naval defeat by Octavian's forces, fled with Antony to Egypt

lifeEvents.title: Antony's suicide
lifeEvents.description: Mark Antony stabbed himself after false report of Cleopatra's death

lifeEvents.title: Death by snake bite
lifeEvents.description: Committed suicide allegedly by asp bite at age 39, ending Ptolemaic dynasty

lifeEvents.title: Born near Vinci, Italy
lifeEvents.description: Born out of wedlock to notary Piero da Vinci and peasant woman Caterina

lifeEvents.title: Moved to Florence
lifeEvents.description: Moved to Florence with father, cultural center of Renaissance

lifeEvents.title: Apprenticed to Verrocchio
lifeEvents.description: Began apprenticeship with master artist Andrea del Verrocchio

lifeEvents.title: Admitted to painters' guild
lifeEvents.description: Became member of Guild of Saint Luke at age 20

lifeEvents.title: First known drawing
lifeEvents.description: Created pen and ink drawing of Arno valley, earliest known dated work

lifeEvents.title: Accused of sodomy
lifeEvents.description: Anonymously accused with others, charges dismissed for lack of evidence

lifeEvents.title: Opened own workshop
lifeEvents.description: Established independent studio in Florence

lifeEvents.title: Moved to Milan
lifeEvents.description: Entered service of Duke Ludovico Sforza as engineer and artist

lifeEvents.title: Painted The Last Supper
lifeEvents.description: Created famous mural in Santa Maria delle Grazie monastery

lifeEvents.title: Designed flying machines
lifeEvents.description: Drew detailed plans for helicopters, parachutes, and ornithopters

lifeEvents.title: Studied human anatomy
lifeEvents.description: Performed over 30 dissections, created detailed anatomical drawings

lifeEvents.title: Milan fell to French
lifeEvents.description: Duke Sforza overthrown, Leonardo fled to Venice then Florence

lifeEvents.title: Served Cesare Borgia
lifeEvents.description: Worked as military engineer for notorious Borgia

lifeEvents.title: Began Mona Lisa
lifeEvents.description: Started portrait of Lisa Gherardini, worked on it for years

lifeEvents.title: Returned to Milan
lifeEvents.description: Worked for French rulers of Milan on various projects

lifeEvents.title: Moved to Rome

lifeEvents.title: Accepted French king's invitation

lifeEvents.title: Right hand paralyzed

lifeEvents.title: Died at Clos Lucé

lifeEvents.title: Born in Coyoacán, Mexico

lifeEvents.title: Contracted polio
lifeEvents.description: Contracted polio at age 6, left her right leg thinner and shorter

lifeEvents.title: Attended National Preparatory School
lifeEvents.description: One of 35 girls among 2,000 students, planned to study medicine

lifeEvents.title: Near-fatal bus accident

lifeEvents.title: Began painting during recovery

lifeEvents.title: Met Diego Rivera
lifeEvents.description: Sought advice from famous muralist about her art

lifeEvents.title: Married Diego Rivera
lifeEvents.description: Married Rivera despite 20-year age difference and family disapproval

lifeEvents.title: First miscarriage
lifeEvents.description: First of several miscarriages due to injuries from accident

lifeEvents.title: Lived in United States
lifeEvents.description: Accompanied Rivera on mural commissions in San Francisco, Detroit, and New York

lifeEvents.title: Miscarriage in Detroit
lifeEvents.description: Traumatic miscarriage inspired painting 'Henry Ford Hospital'

lifeEvents.title: Mother died
lifeEvents.description: Mother Matilde died of cancer while Frida was in Detroit

lifeEvents.title: Returned to Mexico
lifeEvents.description: Moved back to Mexico City, lived in separate houses connected by bridge

lifeEvents.title: Affair with Leon Trotsky
lifeEvents.description: Had affair with exiled Russian revolutionary living in her house

lifeEvents.title: First solo exhibition abroad
lifeEvents.description: First solo show at Julien Levy Gallery in New York, critical success

lifeEvents.title: Divorced Diego Rivera
lifeEvents.description: Divorced after discovering his affair with her sister Cristina

lifeEvents.title: Exhibition in Paris
lifeEvents.description: Exhibited in Paris, Louvre purchased a painting

lifeEvents.title: Remarried Diego Rivera
lifeEvents.description: Remarried Rivera on his 54th birthday with conditions

lifeEvents.title: Father died
lifeEvents.description: Father Guillermo Kahlo died of heart attack

lifeEvents.title: Taught at La Esmeralda
lifeEvents.description: Taught at School of Painting and Sculpture, later from home due to health

lifeEvents.title: Spinal surgery
lifeEvents.description: Underwent spinal fusion surgery in New York

lifeEvents.title: Right leg amputated
lifeEvents.description: Right leg amputated below knee due to gangrene

lifeEvents.title: First solo exhibition in Mexico
lifeEvents.description: Attended opening in ambulance, gave speeches from bed in gallery

lifeEvents.title: Final diary entry
lifeEvents.description: Wrote 'I hope the exit is joyful - and I hope never to return'

lifeEvents.title: Died at Casa Azul
lifeEvents.description: Died at age 47, officially of pulmonary embolism, possible suicide

lifeEvents.title: Born in Louisville, Kentucky
lifeEvents.description: Born Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr. to Cassius Sr. and Odessa Clay

lifeEvents.title: Bike stolen, began boxing
lifeEvents.description: After bike was stolen, told police officer Joe Martin he wanted to 'whup' the thief, Martin taught him to box

lifeEvents.title: First amateur fight
lifeEvents.description: Won first amateur bout by split decision

lifeEvents.title: Won Golden Gloves
lifeEvents.description: Won National Golden Gloves Tournament of Champions twice

lifeEvents.title: Won Olympic gold medal
lifeEvents.description: Won light heavyweight gold at Rome Olympics at age 18

lifeEvents.title: Turned professional
lifeEvents.description: First professional fight, defeated Tunney Hunsaker

lifeEvents.title: Joined Nation of Islam
lifeEvents.description: Attended first Nation of Islam meeting, began conversion process

lifeEvents.title: Announced conversion to Islam
lifeEvents.description: Day after winning title, announced conversion and name change to Cassius X

lifeEvents.title: Defeated Sonny Liston for title
lifeEvents.description: Won world heavyweight championship at age 22, Liston quit on stool

lifeEvents.title: Changed name to Muhammad Ali
lifeEvents.description: Elijah Muhammad gave him name Muhammad Ali, meaning 'beloved of God'

lifeEvents.title: Married Sonji Roi
lifeEvents.description: First marriage lasted 17 months

lifeEvents.title: Refused military induction
lifeEvents.description: Refused induction into U.S. Army citing religious beliefs and opposition to Vietnam War

lifeEvents.title: Stripped of boxing title
lifeEvents.description: Boxing license suspended, title stripped, banned from boxing for 3 years

lifeEvents.title: Married Belinda Boyd
lifeEvents.description: Married 17-year-old Belinda Boyd (later Khalilah Ali), had four children

lifeEvents.title: Supreme Court victory
lifeEvents.description: U.S. Supreme Court unanimously overturned conviction for draft evasion

lifeEvents.title: Fight of the Century vs Frazier
lifeEvents.description: Lost first professional fight to Joe Frazier at Madison Square Garden

lifeEvents.title: Regained title from Foreman
lifeEvents.description: Knocked out George Foreman in 'Rumble in the Jungle' in Zaire

lifeEvents.title: Thrilla in Manila
lifeEvents.description: Defeated Joe Frazier in brutal third fight in Philippines

lifeEvents.title: Married Veronica Porché
lifeEvents.description: Third marriage, had two daughters including Laila Ali

lifeEvents.title: Lost and regained title
lifeEvents.description: Lost to Leon Spinks, then became first three-time heavyweight champion

lifeEvents.title: Retired from boxing
lifeEvents.description: Lost to Trevor Berbick, retired with 56-5 record

lifeEvents.title: Diagnosed with Parkinson's
lifeEvents.description: Diagnosed with Parkinson's syndrome at age 42

lifeEvents.title: Married Yolanda Williams
lifeEvents.description: Fourth and final marriage to Lonnie Williams, childhood friend

lifeEvents.title: Lit Olympic torch
lifeEvents.description: Lit torch at Atlanta Olympics despite visible Parkinson's tremors

lifeEvents.title: Presidential Medal of Freedom
lifeEvents.description: Received highest U.S. civilian honor from President George W. Bush

lifeEvents.title: Died in Scottsdale
lifeEvents.description: Died at age 74 from septic shock after 32-year battle with Parkinson's

lifeEvents.title: Born in Tuskegee, Alabama
lifeEvents.description: Born Rosa Louise McCauley to James and Leona McCauley

lifeEvents.title: Parents separated
lifeEvents.description: Parents separated, moved with mother and brother to Pine Level, Alabama

lifeEvents.title: Attended segregated schools
lifeEvents.description: Attended rural segregated schools, walked to school while white children rode buses

lifeEvents.title: Left high school to care for family
lifeEvents.description: Left school to care for sick grandmother and mother

lifeEvents.title: Married Raymond Parks
lifeEvents.description: Married barber and NAACP member Raymond Parks

lifeEvents.title: Earned high school diploma
lifeEvents.description: Completed high school with husband's support at age 20

lifeEvents.title: Joined NAACP
lifeEvents.description: Joined Montgomery chapter of NAACP, became secretary

lifeEvents.title: Attended Highlander Folk School
lifeEvents.description: Attended desegregation workshop in Tennessee

lifeEvents.title: Refused to Give Up Bus Seat
lifeEvents.description: Arrested for refusing to give up seat to white passenger on Montgomery bus

lifeEvents.title: Montgomery Bus Boycott began
lifeEvents.description: Her arrest sparked 381-day boycott led by Martin Luther King Jr.

lifeEvents.title: Lost job at department store
lifeEvents.description: Fired from job as seamstress due to boycott involvement

lifeEvents.title: Supreme Court ruled on buses
lifeEvents.description: U.S. Supreme Court ruled bus segregation unconstitutional

lifeEvents.title: Moved to Detroit
lifeEvents.description: Relocated to Detroit due to harassment and inability to find work

lifeEvents.title: Worked for Congressman Conyers
lifeEvents.description: Worked as secretary for Congressman John Conyers Jr.

lifeEvents.title: Husband died
lifeEvents.description: Husband Raymond Parks died of throat cancer

lifeEvents.title: Mother died
lifeEvents.description: Mother Leona McCauley died

lifeEvents.title: Brother died
lifeEvents.description: Brother Sylvester McCauley died of cancer

lifeEvents.title: Founded Rosa and Raymond Parks Institute
lifeEvents.description: Co-founded institute for youth development with Elaine Steele

lifeEvents.title: Autobiography published
lifeEvents.description: Published autobiography 'Rosa Parks: My Story'

lifeEvents.title: Assaulted in home
lifeEvents.description: Robbed and assaulted by Joseph Skipper in Detroit home

lifeEvents.title: Presidential Medal of Freedom
lifeEvents.description: Received medal from President Bill Clinton

lifeEvents.title: Congressional Gold Medal
lifeEvents.description: Received highest civilian honor from U.S. Congress

lifeEvents.title: TIME's 20th century heroes
lifeEvents.description: Named one of 20 most influential people of 20th century

lifeEvents.title: Died in Detroit
lifeEvents.description: Died at age 92 of natural causes in Detroit apartment

lifeEvents.title: Lay in honor at Capitol
lifeEvents.description: First woman to lie in honor in U.S. Capitol Rotunda

lifeEvents.title: Born in Málaga, Spain
lifeEvents.description: Born Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Ruiz y Picasso

lifeEvents.title: First painting
lifeEvents.description: Completed first painting 'Le Picador' at age 9

lifeEvents.title: Sister Conchita died
lifeEvents.description: 7-year-old sister died of diphtheria, deeply affected Pablo

lifeEvents.title: Attended art school in Barcelona
lifeEvents.description: Enrolled at School of Fine Arts, quickly advanced past curriculum

lifeEvents.title: First exhibition
lifeEvents.description: First exhibition at Els Quatre Gats café in Barcelona

lifeEvents.title: First trip to Paris
lifeEvents.description: First visit to Paris with friend Carles Casagemas

lifeEvents.title: Blue Period began
lifeEvents.description: Started after friend Casagemas's suicide, painted melancholic works in blue tones

lifeEvents.title: Moved to Paris permanently
lifeEvents.description: Settled in Montmartre at Bateau-Lavoir

lifeEvents.title: Met Fernande Olivier
lifeEvents.description: Met first long-term partner, model for many paintings

lifeEvents.title: Rose Period began
lifeEvents.description: Shifted to warmer colors and circus themes

lifeEvents.title: Met Henri Matisse
lifeEvents.description: Beginning of lifelong rivalry and friendship

lifeEvents.title: Painted Les Demoiselles d'Avignon
lifeEvents.description: Revolutionary painting that launched Cubism

lifeEvents.title: Developed Cubism with Braque
lifeEvents.description: Co-created Cubist movement with Georges Braque

lifeEvents.title: Relationship with Eva Gouel
lifeEvents.description: Relationship ended with Eva's death from illness

lifeEvents.title: Married Olga Khokhlova
lifeEvents.description: Married Russian ballerina, entered high society

lifeEvents.title: Son Paulo born
lifeEvents.description: First child Paulo born to Olga

lifeEvents.title: Neoclassical period
lifeEvents.description: Returned to more traditional forms and classical themes

lifeEvents.title: Met Marie-Thérèse Walter
lifeEvents.description: Met 17-year-old Marie-Thérèse, began secret affair

lifeEvents.title: Daughter Maya born
lifeEvents.description: Daughter María de la Concepción born to Marie-Thérèse

lifeEvents.title: Met Dora Maar
lifeEvents.description: Met photographer Dora Maar, documented Guernica creation

lifeEvents.title: Painted Guernica
lifeEvents.description: Created anti-war masterpiece after bombing of Guernica

lifeEvents.title: WWII in Paris
lifeEvents.description: Remained in Paris during Nazi occupation, banned from exhibiting

lifeEvents.title: Joined Communist Party
lifeEvents.description: Joined French Communist Party after liberation of Paris

lifeEvents.title: Relationship with Françoise Gilot
lifeEvents.description: Ten-year relationship with painter 40 years younger

lifeEvents.title: Son Claude born
lifeEvents.description: Son Claude born to Françoise Gilot

lifeEvents.title: Daughter Paloma born
lifeEvents.description: Daughter Paloma born to Françoise Gilot

lifeEvents.title: Moved to French Riviera
lifeEvents.description: Moved to South of France, worked in Vallauris

lifeEvents.title: Married Jacqueline Roque
lifeEvents.description: Married second wife Jacqueline at age 79

lifeEvents.title: Major retrospectives
lifeEvents.description: Grand Palais and Petit Palais retrospectives in Paris

lifeEvents.title: Died at Mougins
lifeEvents.description: Died at age 91 at home in Mougins, France

lifeEvents.title: Born in London, England
lifeEvents.description: Born Valerie Jane Morris-Goodall in Hampstead, London

lifeEvents.title: Father left for WWII
lifeEvents.description: Father Mortimer joined armed forces, parents later divorced

lifeEvents.title: Received toy chimpanzee
lifeEvents.description: Father gave her stuffed chimpanzee named Jubilee, sparked love of animals

lifeEvents.title: Hid in hen house
lifeEvents.description: Spent hours in hen house to see how chickens laid eggs, early scientific observation

lifeEvents.title: Moved to Bournemouth
lifeEvents.description: Family moved to Bournemouth after war

lifeEvents.title: Left school
lifeEvents.description: Graduated from school, couldn't afford university

lifeEvents.title: Worked as secretary
lifeEvents.description: Worked various jobs including film production assistant

lifeEvents.title: Friend invited her to Kenya
lifeEvents.description: School friend invited her to family farm in Kenya

lifeEvents.title: Sailed to Africa
lifeEvents.description: Traveled by boat to Kenya, fulfilling childhood dream

lifeEvents.title: Met Louis Leakey
lifeEvents.description: Met anthropologist Louis Leakey who became her mentor

lifeEvents.title: Worked at Olduvai Gorge
lifeEvents.description: Assisted Leakey family at archaeological site

lifeEvents.title: Began Gombe Research
lifeEvents.description: Arrived at what is now Gombe Stream National Park to study chimpanzees

lifeEvents.title: First close chimp observation
lifeEvents.description: Chimp she named David Greybeard lost fear of her

lifeEvents.title: Observed tool use
lifeEvents.description: Saw chimps using grass stems to fish termites, revolutionary discovery

lifeEvents.title: National Geographic support
lifeEvents.description: National Geographic began funding research and sent photographer

lifeEvents.title: Married Hugo van Lawick
lifeEvents.description: Married Dutch wildlife photographer sent by National Geographic

lifeEvents.title: Earned PhD from Cambridge
lifeEvents.description: Received doctorate in ethology without undergraduate degree

lifeEvents.title: Son Hugo born
lifeEvents.description: Son Hugo Eric Louis van Lawick born, nicknamed 'Grub'

lifeEvents.title: Founded Gombe research center
lifeEvents.description: Established permanent research station at Gombe

lifeEvents.title: Published first book
lifeEvents.description: 'In the Shadow of Man' became bestseller

lifeEvents.title: Divorced Hugo van Lawick
lifeEvents.description: Divorced after growing apart due to work

lifeEvents.title: Married Derek Bryceson
lifeEvents.description: Married Tanzanian Parliament member and parks director

lifeEvents.title: Husband Derek died
lifeEvents.description: Derek Bryceson died of cancer

lifeEvents.title: Founded Jane Goodall Institute
lifeEvents.description: Established institute for wildlife research and conservation

lifeEvents.title: Published 'The Chimpanzees of Gombe'
lifeEvents.description: Comprehensive scientific work summarizing 25 years of research

lifeEvents.title: Shifted to activism
lifeEvents.description: After conference on chimp conservation, devoted life to activism

lifeEvents.title: Founded Roots & Shoots
lifeEvents.description: Started global youth environmental program

lifeEvents.title: Became UN Messenger of Peace
lifeEvents.description: Appointed by UN Secretary-General Kofi Annan

lifeEvents.title: Created Jane Goodall Legacy Foundation
lifeEvents.description: Established foundation to continue work after her lifetime

lifeEvents.title: Continues global advocacy
lifeEvents.description: Travels 300 days per year advocating for environment and animal welfare

lifeEvents.title: Born in Oxford, England
lifeEvents.description: Born to Frank and Isobel Hawking during WWII, family had moved from London for safety

lifeEvents.title: Family moved to St Albans
lifeEvents.description: Father became head of parasitology at National Institute for Medical Research

lifeEvents.title: Attended St Albans School
lifeEvents.description: Average student but showed aptitude for mathematics and physics

lifeEvents.title: Started at Oxford University
lifeEvents.description: Studied physics at University College, Oxford at age 17

lifeEvents.title: Graduated from Oxford
lifeEvents.description: Received first-class BA degree in physics

lifeEvents.title: Began PhD at Cambridge
lifeEvents.description: Started doctorate in cosmology at Trinity Hall, Cambridge

lifeEvents.title: Diagnosed with ALS
lifeEvents.description: Diagnosed with motor neurone disease at age 21, given 2 years to live

lifeEvents.title: Met Jane Wilde
lifeEvents.description: Met future first wife at New Year's party

lifeEvents.title: Engaged to Jane Wilde
lifeEvents.description: Engagement gave him 'something to live for'

lifeEvents.title: Married Jane Wilde
lifeEvents.description: Married despite his deteriorating health

lifeEvents.title: Completed PhD
lifeEvents.description: PhD thesis 'Properties of Expanding Universes' applied to cosmology

lifeEvents.title: Son Robert born
lifeEvents.description: First child Robert born

lifeEvents.title: Daughter Lucy born
lifeEvents.description: Daughter Lucy born, later became journalist and novelist

lifeEvents.title: Singularity theorems work
lifeEvents.description: With Roger Penrose, proved singularity theorems about black holes

lifeEvents.title: Discovered Hawking radiation
lifeEvents.description: Theoretical discovery that black holes emit radiation

lifeEvents.title: Elected Fellow of Royal Society
lifeEvents.description: One of youngest scientists elected to prestigious society

lifeEvents.title: Son Timothy born
lifeEvents.description: Third child Timothy born

lifeEvents.title: Appointed Lucasian Professor
lifeEvents.description: Held Newton's former position at Cambridge for 30 years

lifeEvents.title: Lost ability to speak
lifeEvents.description: Pneumonia and tracheotomy left him unable to speak naturally

lifeEvents.title: Received computer voice
lifeEvents.description: Given computer-generated voice system that became his trademark

lifeEvents.title: Published 'A Brief History of Time'
lifeEvents.description: Popular science book became international bestseller

lifeEvents.title: Separated from Jane
lifeEvents.description: Separated from first wife after 25 years

lifeEvents.title: Divorced Jane
lifeEvents.description: Divorce finalized from Jane Hawking

lifeEvents.title: Married Elaine Mason
lifeEvents.description: Married his nurse Elaine Mason

lifeEvents.title: Published 'The Universe in a Nutshell'
lifeEvents.description: Follow-up to Brief History became another bestseller

lifeEvents.title: Divorced Elaine Mason
lifeEvents.description: Second divorce amid allegations of abuse

lifeEvents.title: Retired from Lucasian chair
lifeEvents.description: Mandatory retirement at age 67 from prestigious position

lifeEvents.title: Awarded Presidential Medal of Freedom
lifeEvents.description: Received highest U.S. civilian honor from President Obama

lifeEvents.title: Film 'The Theory of Everything' released
lifeEvents.description: Biographical film about his life with Jane won Academy Award

lifeEvents.title: Died in Cambridge
lifeEvents.description: Died peacefully at home at age 76, coincidentally on Einstein's birthday

lifeEvents.title: Born in Saumur, France
lifeEvents.description: Born Gabrielle Bonheur Chanel in poorhouse to unwed mother Eugénie Jeanne Devolle

lifeEvents.title: Mother died
lifeEvents.description: Mother died of tuberculosis when Gabrielle was 11

lifeEvents.title: Sent to orphanage
lifeEvents.description: Father abandoned her at convent orphanage in Aubazine, learned to sew from nuns

lifeEvents.title: Worked as seamstress
lifeEvents.description: Left convent at 18, worked as seamstress and sang in cafés

lifeEvents.title: Acquired nickname 'Coco'
lifeEvents.description: Got nickname from songs she sang at café concerts

lifeEvents.title: Met Étienne Balsan
lifeEvents.description: Became mistress of wealthy textile heir, lived at his château

lifeEvents.title: Started designing hats
lifeEvents.description: Began making hats for Balsan's friends, simple designs contrasted with ornate fashion

lifeEvents.title: Met Arthur 'Boy' Capel
lifeEvents.description: Met English polo player who became patron and love of her life

lifeEvents.title: Opened first boutique
lifeEvents.description: Opened hat boutique at 21 rue Cambon, Paris with Capel's financing

lifeEvents.title: Opened Deauville boutique
lifeEvents.description: Opened second shop in fashionable resort town

lifeEvents.title: Introduced jersey fabric
lifeEvents.description: Revolutionary use of jersey fabric for women's clothing

lifeEvents.title: Boy Capel died
lifeEvents.description: Capel died in car accident, devastating loss for Chanel

lifeEvents.title: Created Chanel No. 5
lifeEvents.description: Launched iconic perfume on fifth day of fifth month

lifeEvents.title: Introduced the Chanel suit
lifeEvents.description: Created collarless jacket and well-fitted skirt in tweed

lifeEvents.title: Introduced little black dress
lifeEvents.description: Vogue called it 'Chanel's Ford' - democratic fashion for all women

lifeEvents.title: Affair with Duke of Westminster
lifeEvents.description: Relationship with one of world's richest men, refused marriage proposals

lifeEvents.title: Launched first jewelry collection
lifeEvents.description: Diamond jewelry collection featuring comet and star motifs

lifeEvents.title: Strike closed business
lifeEvents.description: Workers struck for higher wages, Chanel fired entire workforce

lifeEvents.title: Closed couture house
lifeEvents.description: Closed fashion business at outbreak of WWII

lifeEvents.title: Lived at Ritz during occupation
lifeEvents.description: Remained at Paris Ritz during Nazi occupation

lifeEvents.title: Affair with German officer
lifeEvents.description: Relationship with Baron Hans Günther von Dincklage caused controversy

lifeEvents.title: Arrested and released
lifeEvents.description: Briefly arrested after Liberation, quickly released

lifeEvents.title: Exiled to Switzerland
lifeEvents.description: Lived in Switzerland to escape collaboration accusations

lifeEvents.title: Returned to fashion
lifeEvents.description: Comeback show at age 71, initially criticized but later triumphant

lifeEvents.title: Introduced 2.55 handbag
lifeEvents.description: Created iconic quilted handbag with chain strap

lifeEvents.title: Designed for Jackie Kennedy
lifeEvents.description: Became favorite designer of First Lady

lifeEvents.title: Continued working
lifeEvents.description: Worked until day before death, preparing spring collection

lifeEvents.title: Died at the Ritz
lifeEvents.description: Died in her suite at Hotel Ritz Paris at age 87
